# @zcatalyst/container-plugin

Package that facilitates running the Catalyst compute components such as Catalyst functions and AppSail within in containers.

## Capabilities
* Container components management: Download and manages the Components that are required to run a Catalyst function or AppSail
* Run: Enables running both HTTP and NON-HTTP functions within containers. Port 9000 is used to expose the default HTTP servers to the host network
* Debug: Enables remote debugging of the Functions and AppSails from within the Container. Port 9100 is used to expose the default HTTP servers to the host network
* Support: Supports both Podman and Docker with the Dockerode package as interface
* Binary: Binary/CLI to manage the Catalyst components in local.

## Miscellaneous
* Log Levels: Supported Log levels "info | warn | debug | error". To enable logging the env variable `ZC_LOG_LVL` should be set with the required log level.
```bash
ZC_LOG_LVL=debug catalyst serve # emits the debug logs to the console
```
### Source Access
This is an open source package. If you would like access to the complete source code repository, please contact us at support@zohocatalyst.com
